body:
That seems like a reasonable request :-)

Do you want to implement it?  It seems like you've done quite a lot of the work already!

Unfortunately I don't have access to a dropbox for business account at the moment.
@ncw I am new to golang, so the results might be a bit interesting; but I am totally willing to give it a shot :)
If you want to give it a go, I'm willing to help guide you through it!  Let me know where you get stuck and I'll try to help :-)

@ncw I just got a POC working by building the beta with a Team Member ID hardcoded into [dropbox.go](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/backend/dropbox/dropbox.go#L233-L237)
```
config := dropbox.Config{
		LogLevel:        dropbox.LogOff, // logging in the SDK: LogOff, LogDebug, LogInfo
		Client:          oAuthClient,    // maybe???
		HeaderGenerator: f.headerGenerator,
		AsMemberID: "TEAM MEMBER ID HERE",
	}
```
My friend @adunham-stripe mentioned that I should opt to utilize [client.MembersGetInfo(EMAIL HERE)](https://godoc.org/github.com/dropbox/dropbox-sdk-go-unofficial/dropbox/team#MembersGetInfoArgs) in order to translate an `Email` into `TeamMemberId`. So i'm thinking my next steps will be this:

1. Figure out how Rclone does cli arguments, and try to make a `--dropbox-impersonate` flag that gets fed a strait `TeamMemberId`.
2. Once I'm sure the above is working with any account feed to it, I can move forward with adding `MembersGetInfo` so that I can use emails with the flag instead.

Thanks

-Jake
Ok I got item one working with a new `--dropbox-impersonate` flag. Next up is translating an `Email` to `TeamMemberId`. cc @adunham-stripe.
Great :-)  Translating the Email presumably only needs to be done once at the start?
@jake-stripe how are you doing with this - need help?
@ncw sorry for the delay. I should have some time to poke at this this weekend :)
@jake-stripe no worries - just wanted to make sure you weren't stuck on something I could help with!
